title: Ellen Johnson Sirleaf | Academy of Achievement

time_markers.text: Four days after the announcement of the Nobel Prize
quotes: Four days after the announcement of the Nobel Prize, President Johnson Sirleaf was elected to a second six-year term in office.
Johnson Sirleaf’s choice, George Weah, won a decisive victory in the 2017 election.
In January 2018, Mr. Weah was sworn in as President of Liberia — the country’s first peaceful, democratic transition of power in 73 years.
In 2006, Ellen Johnson Sirleaf took the oath of office as President of Liberia, the first woman to serve as elected leader of an African nation.
The Harvard-educated Johnson Sirleaf served as Minister of Finance before the elected government fell victim to a military coup in 1980.
Five years later, she returned to run for the vice presidency, only to be

organizations.name: Unity Party
quotes: She declined to endorse the nominee of the Unity Party, Vice President Joseph Boakai, and instead threw her support to a former opponent, George Weah, a retired soccer star who enjoyed enormous popularity with the Liberian public.

organizations.name: Mo Ibrahim Foundation
quotes: In making the award, the Mo Ibrahim Foundation cited Johnson Sirleaf’s “transformative leadership” of a country “devastated and broken by 14 years of civil war.”
